New Records: KL Rahul's hundred came off merely 62 balls
This was the fastest World Cup century by an India batter
Key Match Events: Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul added 208 runs in 128 balls for the fifth wicket
Rohit Sharma dismissed Teja Nidamanuru with his off-spin
Kuldeep Yadav trapped Colin Ackermann leg before wicket
Ravindra Jadeja struck with his first ball
Shubman Gill hit four sixes in the first 10 overs
Shubman Gill fell to an excellent catch from Teja Nidamanuru
Virat Kohli lost his wicket after playing an ambitious pull against Bas de Leede
Shreyas Iyer reached his maiden Cricket World Cup ton in the 46th over
KL Rahul reached a century of his own on the back of consecutive sixes in the 50th over
Post-Match Reflections: India openers were off to a characteristic aggressive start on a decent batting track in Bengaluru
No bowler was spared as 15 boundaries came in the first Powerplay
Shubman Gill's six-hitting prowess was particularly impressive
Rohit Kohli took on the bowlers and unleashed some interesting shots
India kept going at a healthy rate as the set Shreyas Iyer took charge with KL Rahul providing him good support
Miscellaneous Highlights: India went close to seven runs an over for most of their innings
The Netherlands started positively despite the overwhelming target
The Dutch joy was short-lived as Kuldeep Yadav and Ravindra Jadeja struck soon after introduction
India's top five batters all scored in excess of fifty
Shubman Gill managed to outdo his skipper and hit four sixes in the first 10 overs as compared to Rohit's one
Rohit Kohli seemed to be gearing up for a record 50th ton but that was not to be the case
Others: India maintained their unbeaten World Cup record against Netherlands
